posts.title: Benton County Empty Bowls Looking To Feed The Future
posts.content:
Benton County Empty Bowls has been using the power of handmade bowls to fight hunger in Northwest Arkansas and Southwest Missouri since 2019 and are in need of someone with a passion for feeding the community to keep the bowls spinning as its founders retire.

  • Bowling for soup: In 2019, Phillip Calkins helped organize Empty Bowls as a nonprofit along with David Johnson, selling handcrafted bowls at the Bella Vista Farmers and Makers Market and donating 100% of the earnings to local food banks — in the last two and a half years, they've donated over $56,000, or half a million meals.
  • Big shoes: Calkins, now 78 years old, is looking to pass the torch to someone eager to contribute, organize events, manage finances, and make a real difference by ensuring the mission of Empty Bowls continues.

Read more about Empty Bowls and find contact information to express interest in this rewarding leadership position HERE.

posts.title: New Study Reveals Cycling Industry's Impact On Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
A recent study performed by the Center for Business & Economic Research at the U of A analyzed the economic and health benefits of biking in Northwest Arkansas, revealing the cycling industry generated $159m from jobs, tourism revenue, and taxes in 2022.

  • The bike biz: Biking-related businesses generated over $100m in revenue, 743 jobs, and $6.1m in state and local taxes, and events like the Walmart UCI Cyclo-Cross World Championship, Square to Square, Joe Martin Stage Race, and others created $59m in revenue, supported 587 jobs, and produced $4.8m in taxes.
  • Healthy habits: 3.7% of NWA residents bike five days a week, reducing the risk of heart disease, stroke, cancer, and diabetes and preventing $59m in chronic health costs. The survey found that 63% of residents own at least one bike, and 12% ride 20 days or more each month.

Read more about the study's findings HERE.

posts.title: Discover Career Opportunities At Drury GO's Farmington Campus
posts.content:
Discover your path to a fulfilling career with Drury GO, the global and online program of Drury University, offering three distinct career-focused pathways at the conveniently located Farmington global campus.

posts.title: Celebrate Juneteenth At The 2023 Freedom Festival
posts.content:
The 2023 Freedom Festival is this weekend, including performances by Bone Thugs-N-Harmony, Ohio Players, Yung Joc, Lisa Knowles & The Brown Singers, and Funk Factory, at Shiloh Square in Downtown Springdale on Saturday, June 17, from 1-9p.

  • At Tha Crossroads: Beyond musical performances, the celebration will include a fashion show with Project Runway star Korto Momolu, multiple giveaways, food trucks, a Black Owned Business Fair, family-friendly activities, a wellness fair, and more.
  • All together: Freedom Festival is presented by Music Moves, INTERFORM, Community Cohesion Project, and the University of Arkansas to commemorate Juneteenth, the oldest known celebration of the full emancipation of enslaved African Americans in the United States in 1865.

Learn more about Freedom Festival HERE.
